overview.introduction:
Hello, I'm Shane . I'm a game front-end engineer with four years and eight months of experience.

My main professional skill is developing game front-end. I am familiar with TypeScript, Cocos Creator, Pixi.js, Unity, OOP, have some knowledge of Design Pattern, and have developed slot games and real-person chess and card games. My hobbies are playing games, reading books, and watching animations. I think my advantage is that I am very strict about the code, whether it is the relationship between categories or the naming of variables; my disadvantage is that sometimes I spend a lot of time on a few lines of code for the sake of readability and cleanliness... . The dream is to find a group of like-minded people to develop independent games in the future.

gameDevSkills.title: Game Front-End Development
gameDevSkills.description:
Game Front-End Development is My interest, and also the part I have the most experience.

The relevant working experience is two and a half years. TypeScript and Pixi.js are the main skills used in my past career, so those are relatively proficient. Although I have used Unity for a lot of time in college, I have used less experience in my career in the past, and my practical experience is relatively weak. However, if I need to use Unity in my work , I believe I can get started quickly, after all, the visual editor is still very close to the people compared to Terminal.

subSkills.description: I taught myself the web development framework in my spare time, but I still have no practical experience and can write simple web pages.

subSkills.name: CSS

webDevSkills.title: Web Front-End Development
webDevSkills.description:
There is no work-related experience using this skill at present, and I am studying hard.

The reason why front-end web development is also listed as my skill is because I think I have the relevant foundation and interest, although I may need to search Stack Overflow from time to time, and the development of webs must not be smoother than the development of games, but I believe that there are no skills that cannot be learned, mainly depends on the amount of effort.

The current level of my web front-end is develop a static website like this, keep up learning ðŸ‘Š

subSkills.name: Enthusiasm
subSkills.description: Since the first Hello World project, I have been very interested in developing games, web pages, and I am very happy to develop on this road in the future!

subSkills.name: Collaboration
subSkills.description: "Perhaps the most important thing in work is not professional skills, but teamwork." This is one of the sentences I realized in my career. Listen to and understand the ideas of your partners more, and everything will be smoother!

subSkills.name: Keep Learning
subSkills.description: Programming Languages and development frameworks are changing with each passing day. Only by keep learning can you strengthen yourself.

generalSkills.title: General Skill
generalSkills.description:
Work doesn't just require professional skills.

Keep making mistakes, keep improving, keep learning, keep finding the most suitable way to get along with the team, with colleagues, and with yourself, keep moving forward, and iterate one after another new self.

Make yourself agile too.

My major is Multimedia Design.

During school, I specialized in game programming, self-taught C# and Unity, and determined to move forward on the road of game engineer.

events.title: The Dojo Software Solutions Inc.
events.description:
Position: Game front-end engineer.
Tools used: Pixi.js, TypeScript.

Main work content:

  • Develop H5 slot games.
  • Maintain the underlying framework and old slot games.
  • Develop game prototype.
  • Write API documentation.

While on the job, I develop five games, assisted in the development of three games, and developed prototypes of two games.

I think the most interesting task is to develop the prototype of the game, because only at this stage can you have access to the most important back-end data and game state processing, and in order to ensure that the prototype is completed, colleagues who will take over later can Itâ€™s difficult to adapt, so I always have to think carefully about the rationality and readability of data planning.

I have learned a lot and met many good colleagues here. It is a very meaningful journey for meðŸ˜Š

events.title: Chuanghui Technology Co., Ltd
events.description:
Position: Game front-end engineer
Tools used: Cocos Creator, TypeScript.

Main work content:

  • Develop real-person chess and card games.
  • Develop chat room feature.
  • Develop reward dealer feature.
  • Develop follow dealer feature.
  • Develop announcement feature.
  • Develop a mini-game that polls requests.
  • Optimize memory consumption and Drawcall.

During my tenure, I developed roulette, color wheel, and Sic Bo into the live chess and card product, as well as added many peripheral functions, such as chat rooms, rewarding dealers, Pay attention to the dealer. Subsequently, mini-game based on HTTP polling were also developed and entered into other product lines.

In addition to these visible things, I also solved some problems related to device heating and game lagging, and learned a lot of Cocos Creator optimization techniques and settings.
